definition: can/to be possible/to be able to/will/to be likely to/to be sure to/to assemble/to meet/to gather/to see/union/group/association/CL:個|个[ge4]/a moment (Taiwan pr. for this sense is [hui3])
flour/noodles/(of food) soft (not crunchy)/(slang) (of a person) ineffectual/spineless
face/side/surface/aspect/top/classifier for flat surfaces such as drums, mirrors, flags etc

sentences.english: She visited her ‘former family’ in Katni regularly.
sentences.chinese: 他也定期与她的‘家人’在卡尼特会面。

sentences.english: I'd like to make an appointment with Professor Smith. Would 9:00 tomorrow be all right?
sentences.chinese: 我想和史密斯教授约个会面时间。明天9点行吗？

sentences.english: This is a perfect place for meetings and social gathering.
sentences.chinese: 中心是各家庭成员会面及社交的最佳汇点。

sentences.english: Biden's biography, he told the crowd, and, after meeting him, declared: 'I think the book is much better.
sentences.chinese: 在与拜登会面后，他告诉众人说，我觉得书要好得多。

sentences.english: It was so simple – a half-an-hour meeting and everything was concluded.
sentences.chinese: 就这么简单，半小时的会面就解决了一切。

sentences.english: May I ask you to postpone the meeting until the day after tomorrow?
sentences.chinese: 人大。可能要求你将会面技术延到后天吗？

sentences.english: But you said it yourself, who wants to meet meat?
sentences.chinese: 不过就像你说的，谁希望与肉会面呢？

sentences.english: We appointed the school-house as place for the meeting.
sentences.chinese: 我们确定校舍为会面地点。

sentences.english: The whole meeting was an elaborately staged act of misdirection.
sentences.chinese: 整个会面就是一场精心安排的误导破案的表演。

sentences.english: I will meet you on the right hand side of the department store.
sentences.chinese: 我将在百货公司的右手边与你会面。

sentences.english: In September, TED and I met at a diner near my office.
sentences.chinese: 九月，TED和我在我办公室附近的一个小餐馆会面。

sentences.english: The original "Beat Generation" writers met in New York.
sentences.chinese: “披头族”的最初作家在纽约会面。

sentences.english: Investors should then rank, on the same scale, their overall impression of the manager from the meeting.
sentences.chinese: 投资者然后应该按照同样的标准给会面后的印象打分。

sentences.english: We have had few opportunities of meeting you.
sentences.chinese: 我们一直没什堋机会和你们会面。

sentences.english: We will meet at 12 at the lobby,is it Ok?
sentences.chinese: 我将于12点在大堂同你会面。你看如何？

sentences.english: I managed to persuade quite a few people to see me, and I must keep the appointments.
sentences.chinese: 我好不容易说服了那么多人和我会面，我必须守约呀。

definition: to arrange an interview/an appointment (with the foreign ambassador)
to meet with (sb who is paying a visit)/CL:次[ci4]
to have an in depth conversation/to have intimate talks/to discuss thoroughly
to talk (with sb)/to have a conversation/talk/conversation/CL:次[ci4]
to receive sb/to grant an interview
to pay a visit/to call on
to confer/to discuss/to engage in talks
